title: Market Intelligence
text: Market intelligence transforms raw agricultural data into actionable insights. By combining AI, mobile platforms, and predictive analytics, we help farmers, cooperatives, and SACCOs in Western Kenya understand pricing trends, buyer demand, and trade opportunities‚Äîlocally and regionally.

title: Market Intelligence
text: Market intelligence transforms raw agricultural data into actionable insights. By combining AI, mobile platforms, and predictive analytics, we help farmers, cooperatives, and SACCOs in Western Kenya understand pricing trends, buyer demand, and trade opportunities‚Äîlocally and regionally.

title: Market Intelligence
text:
Core Features

 Real-Time Price Tracking

Monitor commodity prices across major markets (Eldoret, Kisumu, Nairobi).
Compare farm-gate vs.¬†wholesale vs.¬†retail prices.
Alert farmers when prices hit profitable thresholds.



 Demand Forecasting

Use historical sales and weather data to predict demand for maize, beans, bananas, and sugarcane.
Guide planting decisions based on projected market gaps.
Help cooperatives plan aggregation and storage.



 Logistics Optimization

Recommend transport routes based on road conditions and market timing.
Reduce post-harvest losses with smart dispatch planning.
Integrate with SACCO-owned vehicles and aggregation centers.

title: Market Intelligence
text:
üåæ Crop-Specific Insights

Maize

Track miller demand and seasonal price spikes.
Identify surplus zones and link to deficit counties.



Beans & Pulses

Forecast urban demand during school terms and festive seasons.
Recommend inter-county trade routes.



Bananas & Horticulture

Monitor perishability windows and cold chain needs.
Match supply with urban retailers and export buyers.



Sugarcane

Analyze factory intake schedules and cane maturity zones.
Support contract farming with price transparency.

title: Market Intelligence
text:
üîó Market Data Sources

 KAMIS ‚Äì Kenya Agricultural Market Information System

Daily wholesale and retail prices for key crops
Market-specific data from across Kenya



 KOMEX ‚Äì Kenya Commodity Exchange Analytics

Price trends, volumes, and trade recommendations
Covers maize, beans, rice, wheat, and pulses

title: Market Intelligence
text:
ü§ù Strategic Partnerships

 Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS)

Integrate market data feeds for price validation and policy support.



 County Governments

Co-develop dashboards for trade planning and subsidy targeting.



 Farmer Cooperatives & SACCOs

Share insights via WhatsApp, SMS, and dashboards.
Train members to interpret trends and negotiate better deals.


Contact us

title: Geospatial Intelligence
text: Geospatial intelligence combines satellite imagery, drone data, and AI-powered mapping to optimize land use, climate resilience, and crop targeting. In Western Kenya, this approach is especially powerful for region-specific crops like sugarcane, coffee, maize, beans, and bananas.

title: Geospatial Intelligence
text: Geospatial intelligence combines satellite imagery, drone data, and AI-powered mapping to optimize land use, climate resilience, and crop targeting. In Western Kenya, this approach is especially powerful for region-specific crops like sugarcane, coffee, maize, beans, and bananas.

title: Geospatial Intelligence
text:
Crop-Specific Applications

 Sugarcane

Map high-yield zones based on soil moisture and slope.
Monitor ratoon crop performance using NDVI time series.
Detect waterlogging and plan drainage interventions.



 Coffee

Identify altitude bands optimal for Arabica cultivation.
Overlay shade tree coverage and pest risk zones.
Support certification (Rainforest Alliance, Fairtrade) with traceable maps.



 Maize

Predict drought stress using thermal and vegetation indices.
Guide fertilizer application via soil nutrient maps.
Track seasonal yield variation across counties.



 Beans & Pulses

Cluster agroecological zones for intercropping strategies.
Detect pest hotspots using farmer-uploaded geotagged images.
Model rainfall reliability for short-cycle crops.



 Bananas & Horticulture

Map irrigation potential using proximity to rivers and slope.
Detect disease spread (e.g., banana wilt) via drone imagery.
Plan cold chain logistics from farm to market.

title: Geospatial Intelligence
text:
Strategic Partnerships

 Kenya Seed Company

Target seed varieties to optimal zones using soil and climate data.
Support demo plots and monitor performance via satellite.
Map seed distribution networks and overlay farmer adoption rates.



 Village Industrial (VI)

Identify strategic locations for VI-supported aggregation hubs.
Optimize supply chains with route analytics and cold chain planning.
Empower youth-led drone teams for aerial data collection and analysis.


Reach out

title: About
text:
üå± Farmer-Centered Tools
Our tools start at the farm level, empowering farmers and smallholder networks with adaptive, data-driven solutions:

Price Alerts, Weather Forecasts, and Crop Diagnostics use real-time data and AI to guide decisions based on local conditions.

Platforms for Farm Records and Finance Access provide tailored insights linked to cropping patterns and repayment histories.

Peer-to-Peer Networks foster collaboration and timely advice among farmers.

Market-focused tools like Harvest Forecasting, Demand Mapping, and Smart Routing optimize aggregation, reduce waste, and respond to dynamic market conditions.

These tools enable governments, agricultural companies like Kenya Seed, and NGOs to design programs and interventions that are evidence-based and farmer-focused.



üß† Market Intelligence
Group-level adaptive systems amplify impact across cooperatives, SACCOs, and extension networks:

Credit Scoring and Yield Forecasting evolve with repayment behavior and seasonal performance.

SMS Nudges deliver relevant updates from government programs, cooperatives, and community initiatives.

Research & Trials integrate indigenous knowledge, refine interventions across zones, and ensure innovations remain locally relevant and validated.

This intelligence supports governments and organizations in designing programs, monitoring outcomes, and scaling interventions efficiently.



üó∫Ô∏è Geospatial Intelligence
At the regional scale, geospatial and sensor-driven tools support land use planning, resource allocation, and market linkages:

Soil Health Mapping, Climate Risk Detection, and Crop Suitability Models improve as satellite, drone, and farmer-reported data accumulate.

Disease Detection and IoT Monitoring leverage local samples and sensor feedback for timely interventions.

These insights help county and national governments, companies, and NGOs optimize policy, investments, and operational planning.



üí° Summary
From individual farmers to regional landscapes, our solutions combine real-time data, adaptive learning, and community intelligence to create a resilient, efficient, and sustainable agricultural ecosystem.
We partner with national and county governments, agricultural companies, and NGOs to ensure interventions are evidence-driven, locally grounded, and impactful.

title: About
text: We design adaptive, data-driven tools that empower farmers, cooperatives, and governments to build resilient agricultural systems.

title: About
text: We design adaptive, data-driven tools that empower farmers, cooperatives, and governments to build resilient agricultural systems.

title: About
text:
Mission
To equip farmers and agricultural networks with intelligent, locally grounded tools that drive productivity, sustainability, and inclusive growth.

title: About
text:
Vision
A thriving agricultural ecosystem where every decision‚Äîfrom farm to policy‚Äîis guided by real-time data, community intelligence, and regional relevance.

title: About
text:
Core Values

Farmer-Centered Design: Prioritizing usability, accessibility, and impact at the farm level.

Evidence-Driven Innovation: Evolving tools through data, feedback, and continuous learning.

Local Relevance: Integrating indigenous knowledge, regional context, and stakeholder collaboration.

Transparency & Trust: Building systems that are clear, accountable, and community-validated.

Scalable Impact: Designing for growth and adaptability across all levels.

title: About
text:
Our Approach

Farmer-Centered Tools
Real-time price alerts, crop diagnostics, finance access, and peer networks help farmers make smarter decisions and collaborate effectively. Market tools like harvest forecasting and smart routing reduce waste and improve planning.


Market Intelligence
For cooperatives and SACCOs, we offer credit scoring, yield forecasting, SMS updates, and localized research‚Äîamplifying impact through community feedback and adaptive systems.


Landscape Intelligence
Geospatial tools support land use planning and investment decisions. Soil health maps, climate risk models, and disease detection evolve with satellite, drone, and farmer-reported data.

title: About
text:
Summary
From individual farms to national programs, our solutions combine real-time data, adaptive learning, and community intelligence to create a resilient, efficient, and farmer-centered agricultural ecosystem.

title: Digital Tools
text: Digital tools are transforming agriculture across Western Kenya. By combining mobile technology, AI, and data platforms, we empower farmers to make smarter decisions, reduce risk, and increase productivity.

title: Digital Tools
text: Digital tools are transforming agriculture across Western Kenya. By combining mobile technology, AI, and data platforms, we empower farmers to make smarter decisions, reduce risk, and increase productivity.

title: Digital Tools
text:
Mobile Apps for Farmers

 Market Price Alerts
Real-time updates on commodity prices help farmers: - Choose optimal selling times - Avoid middlemen exploitation - Coordinate with cooperatives for bulk sales


 Weather Forecasts
Hyperlocal forecasts enable: - Timely planting and harvesting - Risk reduction from floods or droughts - Planning irrigation and input use


 Crop Disease Detection
AI-powered image recognition allows farmers to: - Snap photos of affected crops - Receive instant diagnosis and treatment tips - Share findings with extension officers

title: Digital Tools
text:
Farmer Data Platforms

 Farm Productivity Tracking
Track inputs, yields, and seasonal trends to: - Benchmark performance - Identify inefficiencies - Plan future investments


 Access to Financial Services
Link farmers to: - Microfinance institutions - Crop insurance providers - Digital wallets and payment systems


 Community Knowledge Sharing
Enable peer-to-peer learning through: - Success stories and case studies - Localized best practices - Farmer forums and WhatsApp groups

Contact us
